individual_metadata.synopsis: Dialogue with Z'rell when she's upstairs. This takes place after the execution scene, and involves Z'rell mind-melding to see how players dealt with the goblins, and testing their 'desire' to be one with the Absolute via a second mind-meld. She then gives them the mission to aid Balthazar, giving them the key to his chamber, and instructing them to find evidence of where he can be found.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to Z'rell outside Balthazar's Chamber on the upper floor of Moonrise Towers, after the execution scene has resolved.

17.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
17.text: The great liberator. You should go and join your goblin friends out in the curse.

351.speaker: Player
351.text: Get over yourself. I have questions about our mission to find Balthazar.

57.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
57.text: You haven't disappointed me yet, True Soul. I hope, for your sake, you're on Balthazar's trail.

16.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
16.text: So why are you here instead of out there, looking for him?

85.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
85.text: The goblins - tell me how they suffered.

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *Her mind enters yours abruptly, flickering across your memories in a blaze of excitement.*

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *A pool of warmth spreads through your mind as she settles on the memory of you commanding the goblins to die.*

95.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
95.text: Oh, I like you. That was inventive, and efficient.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: And enjoyable. Got any more minions to punish?

436.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
436.text: Plenty. But I hoped someone of your talents would be more ambitious.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: A child could have done it.

303.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
303.text: And what a fine child it would be. But you didn't come here to tear the wings off insects.

480.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
480.text: You came here to answer the Absolute's call. Let's see what you're made of.

464.speaker: Player
464.text: A waste of my time - I didn't come here to clean up other people's mistakes.

220.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
220.text: I can see why the Absolute might be hungry to dig deeper into that mind of yours. I certainly am.

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *Tongues of psychic flame lap at the memory of the goblins dying by your hand.*

161.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
161.text: I see you like to handle underlings physically? So do I.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Got any more for me to punish?

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Sounds like being your underling would be quite enjoyable.

115.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
115.text: For a while. But I get bored of people awfully quickly.

169.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
169.text: Let's see if you can hold my interest.

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *She sees the goblins walking free, and a burning rage fans across your mind like wildfire.*

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Dead, they're a waste. Free, they spread the word of the Absolute.

55.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
55.text: Let's see if there's anything interesting in this brain of yours.

192.speaker: Narrator
192.text: *She parts the folds of your mind again, touching your wants and hopes. Tasting them.*

287.speaker: Narrator
287.text: *Every emotion soaks into her mind's palate, but there is purpose to her exploration - she is searching for proof of your faith.*

391.speaker: Player
391.text: Distract her with thoughts of your aching for Karlach.

374.context: CinematicNodeContext: Z'rell stops the mind-meld, and smiles, pleased with what she saw inside the player's mind

385.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
385.text: She's formidable. But how many days of passion will you get out of her? How many nights? The Absolute will give you something that can last.

147.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
147.text: You have quite the imagination. But that's all it can ever be with you two. Imagination. The Absolute offers the real.

1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Z'rell stops the mind-meld, and scowls at the player, unimpressed by what she saw in their mind

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Distract her with thoughts of your dalliance with Lae'zel.

182.context: CinematicNodeContext: Z'rell stops the mind-meld, and smiles, pleased with what she saw inside the player's mind

454.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
454.text: I've never lain with a githyanki. It looks like this one nearly broke you in half - how invigorating.

141.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
141.text: With the Absolute, your fantasies can become more real than flesh. The pleasures of the mind can surpass those of the body.
141.context: NodeContext: dreamily - just enjoyed looking at some erotic memories

440.context: CinematicNodeContext: Z'rell stops the mind-meld, and scowls at the player, unimpressed by what she saw in their mind

247.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
247.text: Are you trying to impress me with your dalliances? Please - I've lain with everything from an ogre to an ooze.

268.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
268.text: You don't measure up to either.

253.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
253.text: I hope you're a better fighter than you are a lover - I have a mission for you, direct from General Thorm.

307.speaker: Player
307.text: Distract her with thoughts of your sweet moments with Wyll.

149.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
149.text: Forget your love. I have seventeen husbands, scattered across the Coast's shores. They are mere meat.

450.speaker: Player
450.text: Distract her with your yearning for Gale.

31.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
31.text: Hmmmm. You have used the wizard well.

178.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
178.text: But the desperate one who would love such a pathetic man must hunger for greater delights, deep down.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: Distract her with your lusts for Astarion.

410.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
410.text: My, my. Your lust for the neck-pricker is succulent - I'd like to take a bite out of him myself.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Distract her with thoughts of your care for Shadowheart.

357.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
357.text: You took pity on one of Shar's sorry little followers - or was it genuine affection? Let's take a closer look.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Distract her with thoughts of your night with Minthara.

67.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
67.text: How curious - I've only ever known Minthara to moan with pleasure when somebody's losing a limb.

234.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
234.text: She must have liked you - such a shame she'll never smile again. But I'll enjoy the memory of this moment...

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Distract her with thoughts of your romantic desires.

40.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
40.text: You are desired, yet you choose to sleep alone. Are you sure you're not one of Balthazar's walking corpses?

119.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
119.text: The Absolute doesn't demand celibacy - only obedience to Her design.

272.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
272.text: You long to be touched. A shame we're preparing for war, or I might find time for you - but all you truly need is the Absolute.
272.context: InternalNodeContext: Will cover the case where the GoblinHunt night didn't happen has well

218.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
218.text: I see you have been rejected in the past. Do not worry - the Absolute loves you, and that is all that truly matters.
218.context: InternalNodeContext: Based on the check in the previous nodes and the nodes above, if we are going through this node, it is because the player was explicitly rejected by at least one companion and they didnt have any other potential partner nor they had a romantic night with anyone

367.speaker: Player
367.text: Fake it - fill your mind with love for the Absolute.

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *There is a tremor of shared ecstasy as she finds a mirror to her own desire.*

461.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
461.text: Perfect. You crave what all True Souls should - to be touched by the Absolute.

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *For a moment, there is ecstasy as she finds a mirror to her own desire, but then your mind is pulled taut, stretched thin.*

166.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
166.text: The Absolute fills your mind... but you have doubt and anger in your heart, not love.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: My anger outweighs my love, but it's directed toward Her enemies.

173.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
173.text: Control your emotions. When you come to Her, you must allow Her love to push out all other feeling.

386.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
386.text: I have already been blessed to stand in Her presence. It was bliss.

183.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
183.text: She gave me everything I wanted.

444.speaker: Player
444.text: Show me the power She gave you.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Good for you. How do I get what I want?

471.speaker: Player
471.text: Everything? What exactly do you want?

240.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
240.text: To take without asking, to feel without doubting, and to kill without consequence.
240.context: NodeContext: Predatory yet playful. 'I'm in charge, and so I get whatever I want'

475.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
475.context: NodeContext: as if realising what you truly wanted for the first time

365.speaker: Player
365.text: That's a little abstract - show me something real.

405.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
405.text: Oh, why not? What's the point in power if you don't get to have a little fun every now and again?

90.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
90.text: She gave me the power to cut the thread of life with a thought.
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Z'rell closes her eyes, forms a triangle with her fingers, in front of her face, and then claps her hands together abruptly. The nearby ogre guard (S_MOO_ExecutionerOgre), grips its head as if it has a horrible headache, then bellows in pain and falls over dead.

334.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
334.text: But I can caress as well as cut. That's why you should stay on my good side.

409.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
409.text: And the best way to do that is to serve General Thorm. I have a mission for you.

423.text: That's it - play along. The closer you can get to the General, the closer you'll be to the answers you seek.
423.context: NodeContext: telepathic, Daisy not physically present (spoken directly into player's head)

164.speaker: Player
164.text: That was a bit excessive. Will nobody miss the ogre?

363.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
363.text: She'll be back on her feet soon. The General often prefers the dead to the living - they're more malleable.

344.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
344.text: But some missions require warm bodies, and quick minds. That's why I need you.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Warm bodies and quick minds? We might have to meet you halfway.

443.speaker: Player
443.text: I'm at your service - tell me what to do.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: I'll pass - I'm busy enough already.

38.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
38.text: You serve General Thorm. A soldier does not question orders, or choose whether to accept them.

432.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
432.text: There is a relic that General Thorm requires - he sent his most trusted advisor, Disciple Balthazar, to retrieve it.

37.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
37.text: The relic is beneath the Thorm family mausoleum - that is where you will find Balthazar.

414.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
414.text: But we have lost contact with him - go there, aid Balthazar if you can, and bring the relic home.

449.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
449.text: Then he must have failed to make the urgency of his mission clear. I do not want to see you again until the relic is secure at Moonrise.

256.speaker: Player
256.text: Understood - I'm ready to head out.

205.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
205.text: The shadows around the Mausoleum are deep and hungry - you will need a Moonlantern to survive them.
205.context: CinematicNodeContext: [GregRevNote] no mind meld here please

438.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
438.context: CinematicNodeContext: [GregRevNote] no mind meld here please

312.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
312.text: But don't pry - the last person who snooped into his secrets lost their head. I believe he uses it as a chamber pot.
312.context: CinematicNodeContext: [GregRevNote] no mind meld here pleaseNodeContext: Dangerous, but with a knowing smirk

476.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
476.text: Death would not silence Balthazar for long. But dead or alive, he is lost.

60.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
60.text: Whatever has become of him, it is the relic that matters.

484.speaker: Player
484.text: What exactly was this relic he was sent to retrieve?

448.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
448.text: It is something that General Thorm desires, and that he has ordered us to retrieve. That is all you need to know.

133.speaker: Narrator
133.text: *She's suddenly nervous - on edge. Talking about the relic makes her anxious.*

279.speaker: Player
279.text: You said you lost contact - what do you mean?

126.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
126.text: An eye accompanied him - it was destroyed shortly after he left Moonrise.

185.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
185.text: Hardly a surprise - we are protected here, but outside, the shadows are hungry.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: She became anxious when you asked about the relic - probe her thoughts.

46.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
46.text: Whatever Balthazar is looking for, it's crucial to the war effort.

427.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
427.text: True Souls share thoughts - they do not steal them. Guards! We have a spy.

255.speaker: Player
255.text: Talking of this relic makes you anxious - why is that?
255.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player passed a passive insight check, but doesn't have detect thoughts.

24.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
24.text: I am in awe of the power the relic must hold to be of such importance.

153.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
153.text: General Thorm will not leave Moonrise without it.

175.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
175.text: I don't get anxious - I get impatient. You have your mission.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: The relic is vital to Ketheric's plans - you should be giving me more support.

283.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
283.text: Fine. Talk to the bugbear quartermaster - tell him he's to share my secret stash with you.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: I aided Nere in the Underdark - he sought the same thing Balthazar does.

415.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
415.text: Yes, and he failed to find it. Little wonder he hasn't returned here - you have seen how the General deals with incompetents. They bleed.

159.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
159.text: No doubt he's chasing after Balthazar in the dark. I hope he finds him. They're likely to tear one another to pieces.

482.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
482.text: If they do, Balthazar will pull himself back together again. Nere won't - his usefulness has expired.

190.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
190.text: But your utility to our cause has only just begun.

219.speaker: Player
219.text: I live to serve. What do I need to do?

467.speaker: Player
467.text: Oh, do you? Well, it so happens that I have a price.

321.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
321.text: The Absolute's blessings have far greater value than any price you could name. Be wise - obey.

393.speaker: Player
393.text: Apologies. What do I need to do?

265.speaker: Player
265.text: And why should I serve General Thorm?

136.speaker: Narrator
136.text: *You feel her presence in your head again. She grips your mind, squeezing until your vision blurs with pain.*

163.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
163.text: The General is the Absolute's Chosen. Serving him is a great privilege - one that I'm beginning to doubt you deserve.

394.text: She's offering a way forward. You would be wise to play along.
394.context: NodeContext: telepathic, Daisy not physically present (spoken directly into player's head)

203.speaker: Player
203.text: Is it true that General Thorm is invulnerable?

228.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
228.text: Indeed - the Absolute's love for him has made him more than mortal. He is unstoppable.

411.speaker: Narrator
411.text: *Her presence fills your mind, caressing, stroking, kissing... then clawing, biting, cutting.*

466.speaker: Narrator
466.text: *Your pulse races, your heart strains, then as suddenly as it began, the pain becomes overwhelming pleasure.*

417.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
417.text: She gave me the power to delight with a thought - or to kill. So stay on my good side.
417.context: CinematicNodeContext: [gregrerecord note] first past had some odd shifting forward and back, that looked robotic and odd as a closeup shot. Keep sexy intensity, limit movement please.NodeContext: Dangerous, sexy, intimidating

201.speaker: Player
201.text: Sounds good. How do I get what I want?

72.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
72.text: By serving General Thorm - I have a mission for you.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Freedom? Your only purpose is to serve Ketheric and the Absolute.

157.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
157.text: I choose to serve, and I am glad to. Your words are dangerously close to heresy, True Soul.

377.speaker: Player
377.text: My words were a test of your faith. I, too, am glad to serve.

245.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
245.text: As you should be - and you have an opportunity to impress General Thorm. I have a mission for you.

333.speaker: Player
333.text: Don't you aspire to rule rather than serve?

263.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
263.text: Of course - and when Baldur's Gate falls, it won't be long until those that serve General Thorm well will rule the Sword Coast alongside him.

109.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
109.text: You can be among them. I have a mission that will earn you the General's favour.

96.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
96.text: Lies. You would harm Her if you could - I see that clearly. But you'll never have the chance.

313.speaker: Player
313.text: You saw the truth - I'm going to put an end to your so-called god.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Empty your mind. Show her a perfect, harmonious soul.

76.speaker: Narrator
76.text: *You feel her grasp within your thoughts for familiar, roiling zealotry. It finds no purchase.*

243.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
243.text: Simply... void. But why? Why would you not embrace her? Worship her?

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Bring to mind your years of rigorous combat training - show her the depths of your dedication.

319.speaker: Narrator
319.text: *You feel her mind tremble with surprise. She wasn't expecting to see that... but she likes it.*

198.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
198.text: Such single-minded focus... Perfect to be guided by the Absolute's loving hand.

118.speaker: Narrator
118.text: *You feel her mind recoil from yours... disappointed.*

300.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
300.text: Nothing but battle in that brain of yours - typical soldier.

320.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
320.text: However, a blunt implement can still be of use. General Thorm has a mission for you.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Think in Thieves' Cant, masking your true thoughts as Absolutist zealotry.

376.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
376.text: No... just a jumble of nonsense. Shame, I didn't have you pegged as a simpleton.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Distract her by drawing her toward your hunger for power.

462.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
462.text: Exquisite. You're brimming with power already. But the Absolute can give you even more.

473.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
473.text: Caution... hesitation. You fear power, even when it is offered freely. Would you waste the Absolute's gifts as well?

267.speaker: Player
267.text: Lash her with the atrocities you've conducted.

350.speaker: Player
350.text: Overwhelm her by unleashing a wave of hatred as you prepare to attack.

481.speaker: Narrator
481.text: *She has opened her mind fully, expecting to find adoration and faith. Your fury hits her like a bolt in the throat.*

286.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
286.context: CinematicNodeContext: Z'rell recovering from a massive psychic blast she has just received, bleeding from her nose and eyesInternalNodeContext: Combat, player at advantage

408.speaker: Narrator
408.text: *She draws in your fury, and turns it back against you in a tide of raw emotion.*
408.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is staggered, stepping back

33.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
33.text: A spy? Say a last prayer to your god, if you have one. You belong to us now.

56.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
56.text: Yes. Word of the Absolute's mercy - and mercy is not in Her vocabulary!

225.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
225.text: I was hoping you'd be able to help with something more important - but you're only fit to muck out the jail cells.

379.speaker: Player
379.text: Show some respect - I'm a True Soul.

275.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
275.text: That won't keep my blade from your throat if you continue to disappoint me.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: Good - I'll free the rest of the prisoners while I'm down there.

437.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
437.text: I'm going to have to teach you some obedience.
437.context: InternalNodeContext: Hostile to player, disadvantage to player on first roundNodeContext: Fiery, flirtatious, with a dangerous smirk

353.speaker: Player
353.text: They won't get far. Let the curse take them, and save us the job of cleaning up their innards.

150.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
150.text: Never trust an ancient and mysterious curse to do what you could do with your own mind. Or a knife.

349.speaker: Player
349.text: You said I could do whatever I wanted with them - so I did.

224.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
224.text: I didn't expect you to do that.

87.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
87.text: I see you've taken it upon yourself to rescue Isobel for General Thorm...

2.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
2.text: ...and before I even ordered you to do so. Trying to make me look bad, True Soul...?
2.context: NodeContext: Playful and slightly threatening. Toying with the player.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Yes. I have an eye on your position.

281.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
281.text: Oh, do you? Perhaps I'll let you try taking it from me, someday. I think I'd enjoy watching you struggle. And beg.
281.context: NodeContext: Somewhere between lascivious and threatening.

422.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
422.text: But not before time. There is more work for you yet.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: There's nothing I could do to make you look bad.

329.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
329.text: Perhaps I'll take you to my chambers one evening - give you some inspiration.
329.context: NodeContext: Somewhere between lascivious and threatening.

309.speaker: Player
309.text: I did what I had to - Marcus didn't seem capable.

217.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
217.text: 'I did what I had to... I was only following orders... I had no choice.'
217.context: NodeContext: Mockingly parroting the player's words, and adding in some of her own.

368.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
368.text: Lackey's words - leave them to the thralls and goblins downstairs. You are a True Soul, and there is more work to be done befitting your station.

347.speaker: Player
347.text: 'Rescue' is one way of putting it. I abducted her.

122.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
122.text: Rescued, abducted, pleasure, pain... All a matter of perspective. This is where she belongs - with General Thorm.

179.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
179.text: And this is where you belong - standing before me, ready to do more of the Absolute's work.

433.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
433.text: General Thorm has his precious cleric of Selûne by his side, but he's still short a necromancer.

70.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
70.text: Balthazar is still missing. Your success with Isobel will count for little if you don't find him.

282.speaker: Player
282.text: I had a few more questions about the mission.

113.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
113.text: Oh, good. I love answering questions.
113.context: NodeContext: sarcastic - getting sick of your shit

340.speaker: Player
340.text: I aided True Soul Nere in the Underdark - I believe he sought the same relic Balthazar is after?

358.speaker: Player
358.text: I need an idea of what to do next.

468.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
468.text: Have I not been clear? Find Balthazar - and more importantly, the relic he holds. Neither of which, you'll notice, are here.

364.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
364.text: Death would not silence Balthazar for long. But dead or alive, he is lost.

337.speaker: Player
337.text: Balthazar was looking for a relic - what is it?

451.speaker: Player
451.text: She became anxious when you asked about the relic - probe her thoughts.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: You don't like talking about the relic. Why is that?

375.speaker: Player
375.text: The relic is vital to Ketheric's plans - you should be giving me more support.

93.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
93.text: General Thorm's prayers and preparations must not be disturbed. The rooftop is off-limits to everyone.

197.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
197.text: Everyone. Keep watch, and ensure that nobody passes.

97.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
97.text: General Thorm waits at the top of the tower. Hurry on, or he may be tempted to throw you over the edge.

116.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
116.text: I already gave orders to your companions - find the necromancer Balthazar. I spoke slowly, to make sure they'd understand.

124.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
124.text: I've dealt with too much ineptitude already today, and my patience is wearing thinner than a necromancer's bedmate.

134.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
134.text: Let's see if you can hold my interest.

130.speaker: Narrator
130.text: *She pushes into your mind violently, touching your wants and hopes.*

216.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
216.text: Ah, True Soul. The rescue of Isobel went as planned, I hear - how eager you are, in service of the Absolute.

235.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
235.text: Are you here to impress me, True Soul? I hope so, because I have a mission for you.
235.context: InternalNodeContext: If the dialog closed, for example because of a generic reaction, before the mission is given, then we can jump straight to the mission

290.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
290.text: You've been busy, True Soul. I heard how you helped Balthazar. He's returned to Moonrise, with the Nightsong in his possession.

269.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
269.text: But unfortunately it is not all you have done.

403.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
403.text: You visited Last Light. And you brought about the deaths of everyone who sheltered there.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: Of course I did. They were enemies of the Absolute.

314.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
314.text: That may be, but General Thorm wanted one of them returned to Moonrise alive. The Cleric Isobel.

59.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
59.text: Thanks to your interference, she is dead, and the General is most displeased.

310.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
310.text: Go to the rooftop chapel. Retrieving the Nightsong has earned you an audience with General Thorm, and you can explain your failing on the other matter in person.

262.text: We're not the most welcome guests, but Ketheric and the Absolute are waiting for us. Be ready for anything.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: It was not my doing - the shadows consume all in their path.

439.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
439.text: Not all. The cleric Isobel held the shadows from Last Light, and General Thorm wanted her returned to Moonrise alive.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: Would you prefer that I spared the denizens of Last Light?

302.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
302.text: It does not matter what I prefer, it matters what the General commands. And his orders were that the cleric Isobel be brought to Moonrise alive.

332.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
332.text: The General has high expectations of you. You're exceeding them.

455.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
455.text: I hear Balthazar has returned, and more importantly, the Nightsong is with him.

71.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
71.text: And as you've already seen to Isobel's rescue, there's no need for me to keep you any longer... though I could think of a thing or two...

401.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
401.text: But later, perhaps. General Thorm is ready to see you.

128.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
128.text: Plus, if that wasn't enough, you've already rescued Isobel from Last Light. What an eager little thing you are.

346.speaker: Player
346.text: What can I say? I'm good at what I do.

431.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
431.text: I can see... Makes me wonder how deep and dark those talents of yours run...

204.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
204.text: But enough of my daydreaming - General Thorm is ready to see you.
204.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg revis note] mocap contained some wierd sliding issue that reads very odd in closeup. Dont shift forward and back here please.NodeContext: Keep flirty and dangerous

257.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
257.text: Are you ready to stand by his side, in the presence of the Absolute Herself?
257.context: NodeContext: Dangerous - to match previous lines

135.context: NodeContext: telepathic, Daisy not physically present (spoken directly into player's head)

202.speaker: Player
202.text: I've never been more ready for anything in my life.

317.speaker: Astarion
317.text: You're not the only one. We've waited long enough.

384.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
384.text: How confident. We could have had fun, you and I... but duty calls.

487.speaker: Player
487.text: I think so. A little nervous, perhaps.

193.speaker: Astarion
193.text: You, maybe. I'm more than ready.

465.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
465.text: Then go purge those nerves - kill something, or hump something, or both. The general will not tolerate any doubt in his servants.
465.context: NodeContext: Dangerous, with authority. No time for the weak

278.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
278.text: Please. I've been inside you. You're ready.

154.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
154.text: Go on, now. The General is not a man to keep waiting.

479.speaker: Player
479.text: 'Rescued' isn't the word I'd use. I abducted her.

424.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
424.text: Rescued, abducted, pleasure, pain... All a matter of perspective. This is where she belongs - with General Thorm.

362.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
362.text: Now? General Thorm is ready to see you.

326.speaker: Player
326.text: Why would a cleric of Selûne belong here?

342.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
342.text: That is for General Thorm to say. He is ready to see you.

304.speaker: Player
304.text: I don't understand why the General is so interested in her.

306.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
306.text: Don't fret about what you do and do not understand - General Thorm will tell you whatever you need to know. He is ready to see you.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Eager, motivated - call it what you like. So long as you give me what was promised.

318.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
318.text: General Thorm will be most pleased... but there is one more task remaining, before your audience with the Absolute.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: This place is full of lackeys you can send on errands - I want what was promised.

73.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
73.text: Either you show patience, or I'll show you some of my talents in the dungeons. The Absolute's bidding will be done.

426.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
426.text: There is an old inn nearby called Last Light. Some rabble are sheltering there, along with a cleric named Isobel. We have a friend on the inside, watching her.

335.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
335.text: One True Soul already failed in this next task - you must do better.
335.context: NodeContext: Firey, dangerous, threatening - to match previous line

14.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
14.text: Go to the inn, seize Isobel, and bring her back here - alive. Then you will stand before the Absolute.

474.speaker: Player
474.text: Marcus is already dead. Isobel won't let her guard down again.

251.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
251.text: ...You're rather familiar with the details of his failure. As if you were there to witness it.

3.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
3.text: As if you did nothing to prevent it, perhaps?

289.speaker: Player
289.text: He blundered in and got killed. I could hardly report back if I'd done the same.

478.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
478.text: How easily you forgive yourself, with no concept of what your failure means.

156.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
156.text: But I will let the General explain that to you. You served him well in the matter of the Nightsong, after all.

425.speaker: Player
425.text: Forgive me, Disciple. I have no excuse.

6.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
6.text: A worm that knows it is a worm. Had you only revealed it sooner, I would have entrusted this task to someone worthy.

13.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
13.text: Even so... you served the General well in this matter of the Nightsong. The final judgement should be his.

345.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
345.text: Find him on the roof. And pray that he is forgiving.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Why not ask Marcus yourself? I'll send you to join him.

50.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
50.text: ...So you're not an incompetent, but an infidel. Oh, good.

68.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
68.text: I enjoy killing those so much more.

373.speaker: Player
373.text: I've been to Last Light. Without Isobel, everyone there will die.

280.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
280.text: And? They reject the god who raised you.

354.speaker: Player
354.text: Isobel's a cleric of Selûne. What does the Absolute want with her?

107.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
107.text: Aside from her heresy? Every soul sworn to another god is stolen from ours.

43.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
43.text: The fact that you seem to know this place, these people, should make your task all the easier.

127.text: You're so close. Don't lapse now.
127.context: NodeContext: telepathic, Daisy not physically present (spoken directly into player's head)

246.speaker: Player
246.text: Of course not. I will do as you ask.

276.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
276.text: The General does not ask. He speaks his will, and it is so.
276.context: NodeContext: Dismissal - she won't even let us pretend at having a choice.

336.speaker: Player
336.text: Not doubt. I've just had enough of running your errands.

459.speaker: Player
459.text: Why does the Absolute want her alive?

209.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
209.text: We are instruments of Her design. We do not question our role - we simply fulfil it.
209.context: NodeContext: Angrily putting us in our place - 'you know exactly what you need to know'

328.speaker: Player
328.text: In other words: you have no idea.

131.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
131.text: Insolence bores me. It is obedience I require.
131.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, heavy with threat. 'Be a smartass all you want, just do as you're told'

105.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
105.context: NodeContext: Taking our obedience as due, warning us to be quick.

42.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
42.text: Incapacitate the cleric, and our forces will seize her. They wait in the shadows, ready to pounce.

223.speaker: Player
223.text: I think I've had enough of running errands.

352.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
352.text: Pity. I thought you had a little more use in you.
352.context: NodeContext: Disgusted with us, but we're dispensable.

371.speaker: Player
371.text: Where will I find this inn?

158.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
158.text: East, in a blemish of moonsglow, piercing the dark - it is aptly named, this Last Light.

413.speaker: Player
413.text: I know - I've yet to kill you, and all the other vermin in this place.

359.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
359.text: The tower doesn't stink like an overstuffed cemetery - which means Balthazar hasn't returned.

361.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
361.text: The shadows have swallowed Last Light, but the cleric Isobel is not with us. I ordered you to bring her here alive.

74.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
74.text: To be precise, General Thorm ordered that you bring her here alive. I am merely an instrument of his will.

356.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
356.text: Go to the rooftop chapel - you have still earned your audience, and you can explain your failing in person.

485.text: We're not the most welcome guests, but Ketheric and the Absolute are waiting for us. Be ready for anything.

400.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
400.text: The great liberator. You should go and join your goblin friends out in the curse.

447.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
447.text: Go and retrieve Isobel from Last Light. There is nothing else to discuss until it is done.

442.speaker: Player
442.text: Marcus is dead. Isobel won't let her guard down again.

294.speaker: Player
294.text: I'm done with following your orders. I want to see General Thorm.

188.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
188.text: My orders come directly from the General. By all means, go to the rooftop and explain to him why you ignored them.

51.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
51.text: It will likely be the last thing you do.

402.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
402.text: A pity. I was starting to like you. Go to the roof - the General awaits.
